articles.description: Hospitals now have to disclose the rates they privately negotiate with insurers under a Trump administration rule that took effect Friday.

articles.author: Paul LeBlanc, CNN
articles.title: Georgia election official shoots down Trump's election conspiracy theories

articles.title: Trump ally reacts to Trump call with Georgia official
articles.description: Trump ally and former New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie shares his reaction to President Donald Trump's call with Georgia officials in which the President pressured Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger to "find" 11,870 votes.

articles.author: Harmeet Kaur and Kristina Sgueglia, CNN
articles.title: New York's governor wants to make it a crime to sell or administer Covid-19 vaccines to people trying to skip the line
articles.description: The governor said during a news conference on Monday that any entity that misrepresents who they are or distributes the vaccine to those who aren't yet eligible should lose their license and face criminal penalties.

articles.author: Alexis Benveniste, CNN Business
articles.title: More than 170 business leaders sign letter urging Congress to accept Biden's win
articles.description: More than 170 prominent business leaders signed a letter urging Congress to accept the Electoral College results that declared Joe Biden as the next President of the United States.

articles.author: Peter Valdes-Dapena, CNN Business
articles.title: Shareholders approve Fiat Chrysler-PSA merger, will create fourth largest automaker
articles.description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles and Groupe PSA, the French maker of Peugeot and Citroën cars, expect their merger to be complete on January 16th, the companies announced Monday. The newly combined company will be called Stellantis.

articles.author: Katie Lobosco, CNN
articles.title: When will you get your stimulus payment, and how?
articles.description: A second round of stimulus payments are on the way and many eligible families are expected to receive the money this month.

articles.author: Analysis by Nick Paton Walsh, CNN
articles.title: What to make of Iran's half-measures
articles.description: Iran's persistent rhythm of half-measures, a drum beat of self-assertion, rarely lets up, leaving its adversaries -- from hawk to moderate -- able to choose from either of those options. Monday's admission that it is now enriching uranium to the 20% purity le…

articles.author: Mostafa Salem and Hande Atay Alam, CNN
articles.title: Saudi Arabia and Qatar agree to reopen airspace and maritime borders
articles.description: Saudi Arabia and Qatar have agreed to reopen their airspace and maritime borders starting Monday, after a years long freeze on relations, Kuwaiti officials have announced.

articles.author: Clare Duffy, CNN Business
articles.title: Microsoft to AMD: Please help us!
articles.description: Staying home and gaming is definitely a trend during the pandemic, but it has been hard for people to get their hands on the latest consoles.

articles.author: Matt Egan, CNN Business
articles.title: At stake in the Georgia Senate races: The future of America's economy
articles.description: Georgia isn't just the center of the political universe. It's center stage on Wall Street, too.

articles.author: Kevin Liptak and Kaitlan Collins, CNN
articles.title: 'It's a dark place': Call reveals a President consumed
articles.description: President Donald Trump had been trying for weeks to get Georgia's secretary of state on the phone.
articles.content:

articles.title: Georgia election official: Everybody's vote did count
articles.description: Gabriel Sterling, the voting systems implementation manager for the Georgia Secretary of State's office, encouraged citizens to vote in the Georgia runoff election and criticized President Donald Trump for continuing to push baseless voter fraud claims.

articles.author: Tara John, Luke McGee and Nada Bashir, CNN
articles.title: UK Prime Minister imposes harsh lockdown as new Covid-19 variant spreads
articles.description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson reimposed a lockdown in England on Monday as a more transmissible variant of Covid-19 fuels a surge in infections and hospitalizations in the country.

articles.title: Charging decision in Jacob Blake shooting expected in first two weeks of January

articles.title: Pentagon approves DC mayor's request to deploy National Guard for upcoming demonstrations
articles.description: Acting Defense Secretary Christopher Miller on Monday approved a request from the mayor of Washington to deploy DC National Guard forces to the city to support local authorities during demonstrations scheduled here this week, a defense official told CNN.
